channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How one stretch of Interstate 20 through Alabama tells the story of American workers
item.description: Three high-profile labor disputes have unfolded in central Alabama over the past several years, with Amazon warehouse workers, coal miners and autoworkers all speaking out for change.
item.content:encoded:
Three high-profile labor disputes have unfolded in central Alabama over the past several years, with Amazon warehouse workers, coal miners and autoworkers all speaking out for change.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Israel orders Rafah evacuations; Boeing plans to launch a spacecraft
item.description: Israel has ordered Palestinians to evacuate parts of Rafah after cease-fire talks failed. Boeing is set to launch two astronauts to the International Space Station tonight.
item.content:encoded:
Israel has ordered Palestinians to evacuate parts of Rafah after cease-fire talks failed. Boeing is set to launch two astronauts to the International Space Station tonight.

(Image credit: Abir Sultan)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Boeing prepares for Starliner's first crewed launch into space after several setbacks
item.description: The latest test flight comes after multiple delays in the Starliner program and increased scrutiny of Boeing for safety lapses in the production of its commercial aircraft.
item.content:encoded:
The latest test flight comes after multiple delays in the Starliner program and increased scrutiny of Boeing for safety lapses in the production of its commercial aircraft.

(Image credit: Terry Renna)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Israeli army tells Palestinians to evacuate parts of Rafah
item.description: The Israeli military on Monday ordered tens of thousands of displaced Palestinians in Rafah to evacuate, a move indicating Israel's offensive on Gaza's southmost area could be imminent.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military on Monday ordered tens of thousands of displaced Palestinians in Rafah to evacuate, a move indicating Israel's offensive on Gaza's southmost area could be imminent.

(Image credit: -)
item.dc:creator: Vincent Ni

item.title: China makes cheap electric vehicles. Why can't American shoppers buy them?
item.description: American drivers want cheap EVs. Chinese automakers are building them. But you can't buy them in the U.S., thanks to tariffs in the name of U.S. jobs and national security. Two car shoppers weigh in.
item.content:encoded:
American drivers want cheap EVs. Chinese automakers are building them. But you can't buy them in the U.S., thanks to tariffs in the name of U.S. jobs and national security. Two car shoppers weigh in.

(Image credit: STR)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Could better asthma inhalers help patients, and the planet too?
item.description: Some doctors are promoting propellant-free inhalers over puff inhalers that emit greenhouse gases. Climate change can exacerbate respiratory ills because of more fires, air pollution and allergens.
item.content:encoded: Some doctors are promoting propellant-free inhalers over puff inhalers that emit greenhouse gases. Climate change can exacerbate respiratory ills because of more fires, air pollution and allergens.
item.dc:creator: Martha Bebinger

item.title: Is it easy for migrants to enter the U.S.? We went to the border to find out
item.description: Morning Edition spoke to migrants hoping to enter the U.S. and the border agents tasked with keeping them out.
item.content:encoded: Morning Edition spoke to migrants hoping to enter the U.S. and the border agents tasked with keeping them out.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: After a serious car accident, a man pulled over — and continued to help for days
item.description: In 1997, Apryle Oswald got in a car accident. The man who responded went on to help for three more days — driving her dog to the vet and Oswald's boyfriend back and forth to the hospital.
item.content:encoded: In 1997, Apryle Oswald got in a car accident. The man who responded went on to help for three more days — driving her dog to the vet and Oswald's boyfriend back and forth to the hospital.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kwerel

item.title: Up and down the Ganges, India's Modi enjoys support after 10 years of rule
item.description: As Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi looks to win a third term, NPR visited some of his voter base in the north.
item.content:encoded: As Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi looks to win a third term, NPR visited some of his voter base in the north.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Atomic vets are on the verge of losing federal benefits. Congress hasn't helped
item.description: Veterans who helped test nuclear weapons are fighting to renew a 34-year-old law meant to help compensate for the long-term health effects of their work.
item.content:encoded:
Veterans who helped test nuclear weapons are fighting to renew a 34-year-old law meant to help compensate for the long-term health effects of their work.

(Image credit: File)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales
